name: pnp-sp-dev-spfx-web-parts-react-settings-approot
title: SPFx Personal Settings Solution
shortDescription: A full-stack solution for secure, user-specific settings in SharePoint using SPFx, Azure Functions, and Microsoft Graph approot.
longDescription: This sample demonstrates how to build a secure, enterprise-ready solution for managing personal user settings in SharePoint. It uses a SPFx React web part for the UI, an Azure Function API for business logic and security, and Microsoft Graph's approot special folder for per-user storage. The solution implements the On-Behalf-Of (OBO) flow, JWT validation, and CORS, and is ready for real-world deployment.

references.name: Build your first SharePoint client-side web part
references.description: Client-side web parts are client-side components that run in the context of a SharePoint page. Client-side web parts can be deployed to SharePoint environments that support the SharePoint Framework. You can also use modern JavaScript web frameworks, tools, and libraries to build them.

references.name: Microsoft Graph Special Folders
references.description: Learn how to use Microsoft Graph special folders, such as the 'approot' folder, to store and manage user-specific files and settings in OneDrive for Business in a secure and isolated way.

references.name: On-Behalf-Of Flow
references.description: Understand how to implement the OAuth 2.0 On-Behalf-Of (OBO) authentication flow to securely call downstream APIs like Microsoft Graph from your own APIs, while preserving the user's identity and permissions.
